alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 4:39PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Carbon and central Albany Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 439 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Arlington, or 36 miles northwest of Laramie, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elk Mountain, Bow River Campground and Arlington. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 247 and 291. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin
